meanings.definition: A musical composition for one or more voices or instruments.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang a beautiful organum during the concert.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy listening to organum pieces from the medieval era.
meanings.sent3: The organum played by the band sounded like a chorus of angels.
meanings.sent4: Her voice blended with the others in the organum, creating a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The intricate harmonies in the organum resonated throughout the hall.

meanings.definition: A part of an organism that performs a specific function.
meanings.sent1: The heart is a vital organum in the human body.
meanings.sent2: Each organum in the plant contributes to its overall growth.
meanings.sent3: The tiny organum in the insect seemed to have a big job to do.
meanings.sent4: The brain, as the organum of thought, controls our actions.
meanings.sent5: Every organum in the body plays a unique role in maintaining health.

meanings.definition: A keyboard instrument with pipes that produce sound by air pressure.
meanings.sent1: The church organum filled the room with majestic music.
meanings.sent2: Learning to play the organum requires coordination and practice.
meanings.sent3: The organum in the music room had pipes of different sizes.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the organum echoed through the cathedral, enchanting all who listened.
meanings.sent5: The skilled musician played the organum with precision and passion.
